Week of May 26, 2015 <http://blog.pivotal.io/big-data-pivotal/features/20-examples-of-roi-and-results-with-big-data> 20 Examples Of ROI And Results With Big Data According to research from Deutsche Bank <http://blogs.wsj.com/cio/2015/01/11/hadoop-analytics-is-finding-favor-with-more-cios-deutsche-bank-says/>, the expectations for big data have become very real as Apache Hadoop® <http://hadoop.apache.org/> is expected to be prominent in CIO’s analytics investments in 2015. Today, the industry agrees that the third platform is here, as our CEO, Paul Maritz, discussed last year <http://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal/p-o-v/paul-maritz-at-structure-hadoop-is-just-one-ingredient-of-a-profound-shift-in-software>, and IDC expects apps with predictive analytics and machine learning to grow by 65% <http://www.idc.com/getdoc.jsp?containerId=prUS25329114>. READ MORE <http://blog.pivotal.io/big-data-pivotal/features/20-examples-of-roi-and-results-with-big-data> Pivotal Conversations - The Story of Project Sputnik at Dell, with Barton George May 27, 2015 Michael Coté talks to Barton George, Director of Developer Programs at Dell, about the history of Sputnik (which is not a full shipping project in it's fourth generation) and specific tactics he has used along the way.
Listen Now <http://blog.pivotal.io/podcasts-pivotal/features/pivotal-conversations-the-story-of-project-sputnik-at-dell-with-barton-george> Diversity at the Cloud Foundry Summit May 21, 2015 Last week at the inaugural Cloud Foundry Summit, now run by the new Cloud Foundry Foundation, we had a unique opportunity to gather and discuss gender diversity. 125 women attended a luncheon that included a keynote on the gender gap in technology, as well as a panel discussion that focused on gender diversity in an open source software community.
Read More <http://blog.pivotal.io/cloud-foundry-pivotal/p-o-v/diversity-at-the-cloud-foundry-summit> IoT: The New Normal May 21, 2015 Last year, mobile became the new normal for the internet, overtaking PCs for the lead in how users access the internet. Powered by advancements made through this mobile revolution, the industry is on the precipice of a new, bigger revolution: the Internet of Things (IoT).
